metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8065 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
crypto/ccm.c in the Linux kernel 4.9.x and 4.10.x through 4.10.12 interacts incorrectly with the CONFIG_VMAP_STACK option, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash or memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging use of more than one virtual page for a DMA scatterlist.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required
